DOC.brief_title: Exploring the Impact of HIV and ART on Knowledge, Attitudes and Practices in Reproductive Health in Lilongwe, Malawi
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of this study is to identify reproductive health priorities among individuals living with HIV.This study also seeks to explore factors that influence fertility, family planning, and sexual behavior among individuals with HIV who are receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART). This is a mixed method study in which subjects will participate in focused group discussions and complete a questionnaire. Discussions will be 1-2 hours in length aimed to evaluate fertility intentions, family planning, and sexual health behaviors. Data collected from the focus groups will be analyzed for common themes to generate questionnaires to assess reproductive health knowledge, attitudes and practices related to family planning, and fertility and sexual health among persons living with HIV.
DOC.criteria: Focus Group Arm Client registered at either of the participating Lighthouse clinics (Kamuzu Central Hospital (KCH) or Bwaila Hospital) On antiretroviral treatment (ART) for the past 6 months Sexually active within the past 6 months HIV positive No exclusion criteria specified Questionnaire Arm Client registered at either of the participating Lighthouse clinics (Kamuzu Central Hospital (KCH) or Bwaila Hospital) Sexually active within the past 6 month HIV positive No exclusion criteria specified
